problem_text:
Let X be a non-empty class of finite groups closed under taking homomorphic images, subgroups, and direct products. With every group G ∈ X we associate some set τ(G) of subgroups of G. We say that τ is a subgroup functor on X if:
1) G ∈ τ(G) for all G ∈ X, and
2) for each epimorphism φ : A 7→ B, where A, B ∈ X, and for any H ∈ τ(A) and T ∈ τ(B) we have Hφ ∈ τ(B) and Tφ−1 ∈ τ(A).
A subgroup functor τ is closed if for each group G ∈ X and for every subgroup H ∈ X ∩ τ(G) we have τ(H) ⊆ τ(G). The set F(X) consisting of all closed subgroup functors on X is a lattice (in which τ1 ⩽ τ2 if and only if τ1(G) ⊆ τ2(G) for every group G ∈ X). It is known that F(X) is a chain if and only if X a class of p-groups for some prime p (Theorem 1.5.17 in S. F. Kamornikov and M. V. Sel’kin, Subgroups functors and classes of finite groups, Belaruskaya Navuka, Minsk, 2001 (Russian)). Is there a non-nilpotent class X such that the width of the lattice F(X) is at most |π(X)| where π(X) is the set of all prime divisors of the orders of the groups in X ?
A. N. Skiba
answer: No such classes exist (S. F. Kamornikov, Siberian Math. J., 51, no. 5 (2010), 824–829).
